page.title: 01Summary of Bwlchysarnau
page.content: This district around the small village of Bwlchysarnau is an upland rural area of scattered farmsteads.There are 27 dwellings with a population of 88. The primary occupation is hill farming , mainly sheep with ancillary beef cattle rearing. The land is wet & acidic but some has been drained and reseeded recently.The poorest land has been planted with conifers by the Forestry Commission. The village itself consists of 9 houses, a Baptist Church and a Primary School clustered on a pass where 4 roads meet. Most of the houses have mains water,all have mains electricity and drainage is by septic tank.There are no street lights. Social life revolves around the Baptist Church & school, with a thriving Womens Institute,Youth group, Mother & Toddler Group and choir.
